title: Terror Attack at Manchester Synagogue on Yom Kippur Kills Two
snippets: Two Jewish people died in a car and stabbing attack at Heaton Park Hebrew Congregation Synagogue on the holiest day in the Jewish religious calendar.
Keir Starmer says Britain must defeat rising antisemitic hatred.
Authorities in the UK are investigating what they described as a terrorist incident outside a synagogue in Manchester.
A car was rammed into pedestrians and at one person stabbed as worshippers arrived to celebrate Yom Kippur.
Police in the UK have declared a major incident outside a synagogue in Manchester. Two people died of their injuries, and the attacker was confirmed to be dead after police opened fire.
UK authorities step up security at Jewish sites after what Starmer denounces as a terrorist incident

Police say they believe they know identity of man behind car and knife attack that left four people seriously injured

  • Manchester synagogue stabbing – latest updat
Two people were killed and at least four others were in serious condition after the vehicle ramming and stabbing attack on Yom Kippur. Police said the suspect was dead.

Witnesses screamed ‘he’s got a bomb’ and ‘shoot him’ before suspect was killed by armed police

  • Manchester synagogue stabbing – latest updates

North of England editor Josh Halliday reports from the scene of the attack on Heaton Park Hebrew Congregation synagogue, in which two people were killed and three others seriously injured, in what appears to be the worst antisemitic incident in the UK in living memory

On Thursday morning at
titles: Worshippers helped stop suspect from entering synagogue - what we know about attack
Manchester Synagogue Attack: What We Know So Far
What we know about deadly UK synagogue attack
Deadly Manchester synagogue attack: What we know about victims and attacker
Manchester: 2 killed in synagogue car, knife attack
Two killed in attack at Manchester synagogue
Manchester synagogue terror attack: two killed and suspect shot dead
Synagogue Attack on Yom Kippur in Manchester, UK: What We Know
Six minutes of terror: how Manchester synagogue attack unfolded
The Manchester synagogue terror attack – Today in Focus Extra
summary: A terrorist attack occurred outside the Heaton Park Hebrew Congregation synagogue in Manchester, England, on Yom Kippur, Judaism's holiest day. A man rammed a car into pedestrians and stabbed others, resulting in two fatalities and several serious injuries. The attacker was shot dead by police within minutes. Prime Minister Keir Starmer described the incident as "appalling" and left a European summit in Copenhagen early in response. UK authorities have increased security at Jewish sites following the attack. Two additional suspects were arrested in connection with the incident.

title: Tesla Hikes Lease Prices Amid Record Q3 Deliveries, Tax Credit Expiry
snippets: Analysts expect sales by the electric automaker to slump in the months ahead.
Tesla hikes lease prices as EV tax credit expires
Tesla's third-quarter deliveries got a boost as some consumers rush to buy electric vehicles before a federal tax credit expired.
Q3 deliveries increased for first time in three quarters
Tesla Inc. reported a surprise record quarter of vehicle sales as US consumers accelerated electric-car purchases before federal tax credits expired.
titles: Tesla sales jump as buyers scramble before EV tax credit expires
Tesla hikes lease prices as EV tax credit expires - Axios
Tesla deliveries rise 7% before EV tax credits expire
Tesla sales hit record as US buyers rush to beat end of tax credits
Tesla sales surge to record on rush to snag U.S. tax credit
summary: Tesla increased its lease prices following a surge in third-quarter deliveries, with 497,000 vehicles delivered as consumers rushed to purchase electric vehicles before the expiration of a $7,500 federal tax credit on September 30. This expiration motivated buyers and contributed to Tesla's sales growth.

title: Perplexity's Comet Browser Now Free, Aims to Elevate Content Quality
snippets: Perplexity initially launched Comet in July to Perplexity Max subscribers for $200 a month
Perplexity's Comet browser is now free as the AI startup fights low-quality content and partners with publishers like CNN and The Washington Post.

After launching to subscribers willing to fork out hundreds of dollars a month this summer, Perplexity’s agentic AI browser Comet is now available to everyone for free. “The internet is better on Comet,” the company says, promising to remain free forever as it styles the browser as a serious challen

AI search startup Perplexity is making its new Comet browser available to everyone in the world for free as it works to position the product against big browsers and search engines. For certain paid subscribers, the startup has also launched a new ‘background assistant’ to handle multiple tasks via

summary: Perplexity launched its Comet browser in July for $200 a month to Perplexity Max subscribers. Now, the AI startup has made Comet free for all users, aiming to combat low-quality content and collaborating with publishers like CNN and The Washington Post. This move positions Comet as a competitor to major browsers and includes a 'background assistant' feature for certain paid subscribers.

title: Flotilla to Gaza, Including Greta Thunberg, Intercepted by Israel
snippets: South Africa and Turkey have criticised the incident in international waters. Israel says those on board are safe.
Israel said its navy intercepted all but one of the boats in the Global Sumud Flotilla, an international convoy that was attempting to break the siege of Gaza.
The boats were part of a flotilla, carrying Greta Thunberg and other activists, that was organized to break Israel’s blockade and protest the war.
The Israeli government said it had detained activists who were trying to take humanitarian aid to the blockaded enclave.
titles: Israel intercepts Gaza flotilla and detains activists including Greta Thunberg

Israel Detains Activists After Intercepting Flotilla Headed to Gaza: What to Know
summary: The Global Sumud Flotilla, aiming to break Israel's blockade of Gaza and deliver aid, has faced challenges as 13 of its boats were intercepted. The flotilla, which includes activist Greta Thunberg, continues its mission toward the Palestinian enclave despite these setbacks.

title: Morocco Protests Turn Violent: 2 Dead, Hundreds Injured; Unrest in Madagascar
snippets: Police say they shot dead two people who were part of a crowd trying to storm a police station.

After almost a week of regular demonstrations, protests in Morocco turned violent, resulting in hundreds injured and two deaths. Who's behind the protests, what are they demanding, and where might this end?
A youth-led movement against the president of Madagascar is sustaining protests across the country. John Eligon, the Johannesburg bureau chief for The New York Times, explains what’s happened.
titles: First killings in Morocco since Gen Z protests erupted
Morocco's Gen Z protests: What you need to know
What We Know About the Protests in Madagascar
summary: In Morocco, protests demanding unspecified changes turned violent, leading to two deaths and hundreds injured as police shot two individuals storming a station. Meanwhile, in Madagascar, a youth-led movement protests against the president, as reported by John Eligon. Both countries are experiencing significant unrest.

title: Man Found Stabbed to Death on Ottawa's St. Laurent Boulevard
snippets: Ottawa police say a man is dead after an alleged stabbing that occurred on St. Laurent Boulevard in the city's east end Thursday morning.
Police found the victim with numerous stab wounds at about 7 a.m. on St Laurent Boulevard.
titles: Man dead after stabbing in Ottawa’s east end: police
Homicide squad investigating stabbing death of man in east end
summary: A man was found dead with multiple stab wounds on St. Laurent Boulevard in Ottawa's east end early Thursday morning, according to police. The incident, reported at about 7 a.m., is being investigated as a stabbing.

title: Green Project Funding Canceled in 16 States by OMB Director

summary: The Office of Management and Budget Director, Russ Vought, announced the cancellation of funding for green projects in 16 states, all of which had voted for Kamala Harris. Following Vought's statement, the Energy Department terminated the awards program. This decision affects billions in green energy funding previously allocated.

title: Trump Administration Cancels 300+ Clean Energy Awards, Targets Democrat States
snippets: The cuts largely affect Democratic-led states as the two parties fight over the shutdown of the federal government.
The Trump administration canceled over 300 awards related to clean energy on October 1. The states most affected by the cuts voted for Democrat presidential candidate Kamala Harris.
titles: Energy Dept. Cancels $7.5 Billion for Hundreds of Projects, Mostly in Blue States
Department of Energy cancels $7.5B of clean energy projects in mostly blue states
summary: On October 1, the Trump administration canceled more than 300 clean energy awards, predominantly impacting Democratic-led states. This action comes amid a broader political conflict between the two parties regarding the federal government shutdown. The states most affected by these cancellations had supported Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris.

title: NFL to Launch Men's and Women's Flag Football Leagues
snippets: “We’re committed to creating a women’s professional league, and a men’s professional flag league," Goodell said at an event in London.
The NFL plans to launch women’s and men’s professional flag football leagues “in the next couple of years,” commissioner Roger Goodell said Thursday.
titles: The NFL is launching professional flag football leagues for both men and women, Commissioner Roger Goodell says
NFL plans to launch professional flag football leagues ahead of Los Angeles Olympics
summary: The NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell announced plans to launch women's and men's professional flag football leagues within the next few years. This statement was made during an event in London, emphasizing the NFL's commitment to expanding its reach and inclusivity in sports.

title: Attack Outside Manchester Synagogue on Yom Kippur; Assailant Shot by Police
snippets: Prime Minister Keir Starmer called the attack outside a synagogue in Manchester, England, "all the more horrific" for taking place on Yom Kippur, Judaism's holiest day.
The police said a man drove a car into people in front of the synagogue in Manchester, England, and stabbed others. The assailant was shot dead by the police.
titles: U.K. police investigate Manchester's deadly synagogue attack as a terrorist incident
Deadly Car Ramming and Stabbing at U.K. Synagogue Is Declared Terrorist Attack
summary: A man attacked individuals outside a synagogue in Manchester, England, by driving a car into them and then stabbing others. The incident, occurring on Yom Kippur, Judaism's holiest day, was condemned by Prime Minister Keir Starmer as "all the more horrific." The assailant was shot dead by police.

title: Terror Attack at Manchester Synagogue on Yom Kippur Kills Two
snippets: Officers fatally shot a man who had rammed a car into some people and stabbed others outside the Heaton Park Hebrew Congregation, police said.
The police said a man drove a car into people in front of the synagogue in Manchester, England, and stabbed others. The assailant was shot dead by the police.
titles: Two killed in attack at synagogue on Yom Kippur in England
Live Updates: 2 Killed in Attack at British Synagogue on Yom Kippur
summary: A terrorist attack occurred outside the Heaton Park Hebrew Congregation synagogue in Manchester, England, on Yom Kippur, Judaism's holiest day. A man rammed a car into pedestrians and stabbed others, resulting in two fatalities and several serious injuries. The attacker was shot dead by police within minutes. Prime Minister Keir Starmer described the incident as "appalling" and left a European summit in Copenhagen early in response. UK authorities have increased security at Jewish sites following the attack. Two additional suspects were arrested in connection with the incident.

title: Renowned Primatologist Jane Goodall Dies, Leaves Conservation Legacy
snippets: Jane Goodall, the conservationist and primatologist renowned for her groundbreaking research on chimpanzees, has died.

Famed primatologist Jane Goodall was renowned for her groundbreaking work with chimpanzees but dedicated her life to helping all wild animals—a passion that lasted until her death this week while on a U.S. speaking tour.
titles: Renowned chimpanzee researcher Jane Goodall dies at 91
What to know about the life and legacy of chimpanzee researcher and wildlife advocate Jane Goodall
summary: Renowned conservationist and primatologist Jane Goodall, known for her pioneering research on chimpanzees, has passed away. Goodall, who was on a speaking tour in the U.S., dedicated her life to the protection of wild animals. Her contributions to science and conservation have left a lasting legacy.

title: Amazon Launches "Add to Delivery" Feature for Prime Members in the US
snippets: Amazon has announced a new shopping feature for US Prime members called Add to Delivery that lets you add additional items to completed orders that have yet to be delivered, instead of having to create an entirely new order. The feature is only available on Amazon’s app and on Amazon.com when access
Amazon's new "Add to today's delivery" button makes it easier for Prime members to buy more and tack on items to existing orders.
titles: Amazon now lets Prime members add items to completed orders
Amazon now lets Prime members add items to upcoming orders with one tap
summary: Amazon launched a feature for US Prime members called "Add to Delivery," allowing them to add items to orders already in progress. This aims to streamline shopping by eliminating the need for separate orders for additional items. The feature is accessible exclusively through the Amazon app and website.

title: UK Prime Minister, King Condemn Manchester Synagogue Stabbing as Antisemitism
snippets: The prime minister said Britain must defeat antisemitic hate, as the King, religious leaders and politicians issue statements.

summary: The Prime Minister of Britain has labeled a stabbing at a Manchester synagogue as an act of antisemitism and declared the nation's commitment to combating the hatred behind it. This statement was made alongside remarks from the King, religious leaders, and politicians, all condemning the attack and emphasizing the need to fight antisemitic hate.

title: Meta's Threads Introduces Communities Feature for Interest-Based Engagement
snippets: Threads is testing a new feature called communities globally on its web platform and mobile apps, which will serve as dedicated spaces where you can find content or posts about your favorite topics. Starting today, you can explore different communities surrounding things like professional basketball
The idea, explains Meta, is to give users dedicated spaces within the app where they can delve deeper into conversations on topics that matter to them.
titles: Threads adds communities to put your interests front and center

summary: Threads, a platform by Meta, is rolling out a new feature named communities on its web and mobile applications worldwide. Communities are designed as specific areas for users to discover and engage with content related to their interests, such as professional basketball. This update aims to enhance user experience by facilitating deeper discussions on preferred topics.

title: PGA CEO to Apologize for Ryder Cup Abuse, Says No Place in Golf
snippets: There is "no place in golf" for the abuse suffered by Rory McIlroy and Team Europe at the Ryder Cup, says PGA of America CEO Derek Sprague.
PGA of America chief executive Derek Sprague says the abuse Rory McIlroy and his family suffered at the Ryder Cup "crossed the line" and he plans on apologising to them.
titles: PGA chief to apologise to McIlroy family over Ryder Cup abuse

summary: PGA of America CEO Derek Sprague stated that the abuse directed at Rory McIlroy and Team Europe during the Ryder Cup was unacceptable and crossed the line. He plans to apologize to McIlroy and his family, emphasizing there is "no place in golf" for such behavior.
